LayoutNode.Content: Managing Your Account › Account Settings › Archive an Order
LayoutNode.SRC:
Managing Your Account › Account Settings›

Archive an Order

LayoutNode.Content: You can archive orders that you’re no longer interested in referencing, hide items fromimmediate view that may be embarrassing, or keep gifts secret if you share an account withyour children or significant other. Account Settings
LayoutNode.SRC:
You can archive orders that you’re no longer interested in referencing, hide items from immediate view that may be embarrassing, or keep gifts secret if you share an account with your children or significant other.

Account Settings

LayoutNode.Content: About Closing Your Account About Mobile Phone Number Accounts About SMS Verification for Mobile Phone Number Accounts Remove an Adult from Your Amazon Household About Amazon Households Digital Content & Personalisation Resources About Two-Step Verification To archive an order: Go to Your Orders and locate the applicable order. Select Archive order . Archiving orders doesn’t delete orders permanently. It removes them from your default order history view. Archived items will always show up when you search for them. You can also access archived orders by visiting Your Account and selecting View Archived Orders . To restore an archived order to your default order history view, select Unarchive Order . Was this information helpful?

It removes them from your default order history view.Archived items will always show up when you search for them. You can also access archived orders by visitingYour Account and selecting View Archived Orders. To restore an archived order to your default order historyview, select Unarchive Order.
